On 1/17/11 11:14 PM, Colin Rosenthal wrote:
> Hi,
> I'm using heritirx 1.14.3 to harvest some material from facebook. My crawl log has lines like this:
>
> 2011-01-17T16:05:06.526Z   404      11224 http://www.facebook.com//hellethorningschmidt?v=photos&sb=0 X http://www.facebook.com/hellethorningschmidt?v=photos text/html #033 20110117160506113+404 sha1:YWIIR2C2FR3J6ZTH7KCHBPCGTUL4SFPP - content-size:11451
>
> The problem is that the url
> a) http://www.facebook.com//hellethorningschmidt?v=photos&sb=0
> should be
> b) http://www.facebook.com/hellethorningschmidt?v=photos&sb=0
>
> Does anyone know where the extra forward slash is coming from?

It looks like the Heritrix JS-extraction code -- which is very 
simpleminded, just scanning for URI-like strings -- wasn't performing as 
much JS-specific unescaping as would be ideal.

More info is in this JIRA issue I just addedd:

https://webarchive.jira.com/browse/HER-1859

Fixes have been committed to the H1 and H3 source trees to appear in the 
next official releases. It was a one-line fix in SVN TRUNK, but I 
believe the ExtractorJS code has undergone enough refactoring since 
1.14.3 that it might be a little harder to apply to your version.

- Gordon @ IA
